page.title: 10KILBURN(DERBY)AREA FARM LAND
page.content: Most of our area farmland is given over to grazing for cattle, being a mixture of rough grazing and cultivated meadow. The majority of the milk thus produced goes to supply local demand, a small percentage going to the making of dairy produce. Pigs and poultry are kept on an individual farms but in small numbers only with no local policy or pattern. Several local farmers also grow crops, chiefly barley,with an occasional crop of kale or marigold. The area is also criss_crossed by a network of footpaths, and local farmers respect their existence. The area is little affected by tourism, since the most visitors are passing through on their way elsewhere. Denby Pottery is probably the only spot in the area to attract visitors from any distance.
